page.title: 03Tagon Farm,Voe.
page.content: Tagon farm consists of 600 acres of mainly hill land. This land is suitable for the Shetland sheep which are kept on the farm.There are about 200 sheep altogether but not all of these are Shetland,some Cheviots and Suffolks are kept as well. The Shetland sheep is one of the smallest of British breeds and is bred because of the softness of its wool and the goodness of its mutton. It can live on heathery and rough grass and this hardy breed can survive the cold winter.They are brought down from the hill in the Spring to lamb.A vigilant watch is kept on the sheep at this time in case there are any problems with lambing. Seven cows are also kept on the farm;3 Jerseys,2 Simmenthal Crosses,1 Fresian and 1 Ayreshire.
